metadata: (info { (description "Lupo e Pecore is a game which is included in a sixteenth century compendium of games from Venice.") (rules "Four 2x3 rectangles, arranged in the form of a cross, with 2x2 squares in the center. Diagonals drawn in every 2x2 square. Played on the intersections of the lines.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "996") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/hunt/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Italy, from around 1500 to 1599.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges Diagonal Hidden) })
